content: Have any of you had to take short term disability until you were able to get some pain relief? I posted a few days ago...I currently recovered from Covid (I was in the hospital), prior to Covid I was able to manage my neuropathy...NOW I can barely breathe the pain is SO BAD. I had a visit with my neurologist last Thursday he noticed a bump on my arm, I'm getting a biopsy next 2 weeks. I'm waiting for the pain management clinic to approve me. I work from home..but sitting at the computer kills me... since covid my left hand is twice the size of my right... I have this unbearable pain that just started in my arm..my fingers are starting to curl, when this happens I have no control of my hand.  The intense burning in my calves and feet are more than I can handle.  The neurologist poked my left foot with 3 different needles..I couldn't feel it at all.  I NEVER SLEEP I'm going crazy.  I have no quality of life.  Covid has really really taken a toll on my neuropathy and my neurologist said they are still trying to figure out options for this.  I'm so afraid of losing my job I was once the top sales rep of the company.. now im the lowest..I can't think straight..I'm in so much pain.  I've tried marijuana, edibles (never again), I'm on 2400 mg of gabapentin, lyrica, cymbalta NOTHING IS WORKING!!!! My dr mentioned looking into SSI but idk how that works in terms of pay, I make a good amount of money and I dont know if SSI if approved matches your current pay...does anyone know how that works? Thank you!
comment: insurance for the next 2 years is a big problem. it's too expensive to pay for it.

content: If you are diabetic and have neuropathy, your insurance will most likely pay for one pair of shoes per year for you.  You would have to go to a podiatrist to order them.  In the USA.
comment: insurance costs for #insurance companies arent so good.  I try to find a better way to afford my prescription medications!

content: In case noone saw my response in regards to my post last week about the red light therapy session that worked really well with the pain..REALLY WELL the day after..here is the link for the machine my therapist used. She said the machine is spendy but designed to stimulate the nervous system. The next day I felt great no pain..but you have to use this machine everyday.  I'm going to see if I can get my insurance to cover one.  My pain is back to  horrible again.
comment: insurance company is taking advantage of the cost of #medicare for all.

content: hola alguien que hable español? tengo 5 meses con neuropatia diabética y es horrible 😭ya no puedo soportar mas estos horribles dolores son el infierno en vida mi doctora de la diabetes me da gabapentin y no me ayuda en nada me queman me pican los pies ya no puedo caminar bien alguien sabe que especialista puedo ir para tratar esta terrible enfermedad veo y leo todo lo que ustedes publican y se que no estoy sola pero esto no es vida ami se me acabo mi vida con esta enfermedad mi niña es la que me alienta a seguir porque si no no se que hibiera hecho ya 😭hello anyone who speaks Spanish? I have 5 months with diabetic neuropathy and it's horrible 😭 I can't stand anymore these horrible pains are hell in life my diabetes doctor gives me gabapentin and does not help me anything burn my feet itch I can no longer walk well someone knows that specialist I can go to treat this terrible disease I see and read everything you guys post and I know I'm not alone but this is not life ami I ended my life with this disease my girl is the one that encourages me to follow Because if not I don't know what I had done already 😭 · Rate this translation
comment: diabetes is a chronic disease. it is not one you can see, but a disability that you can feel.  I try to take a lot of care of my brain. I want to get a better experience and better experience with my family.

content: Good morning!  I have a lot to learn!  My dad is a bagel with butter every morning guy.  He's a farm boy, meat a potatoes.  He also has high cholesterol.  My dilemma is breakfast.  He can't do the bagel every morning, but he can't do bacon and eggs. What do you do for breakfast?
comment: blood sugar can be hard to do.  I try to get a lot of love from my friends and family.

content: I’m in emergency room right now dealing with crashes that hit 60.
comment: Low blood sugar can be a expensive issue in the united states.  insurance companies and #healthcare companies are a problem.

content: Does anyone have a problem with bd pen needles? I find that they don’t release insulin and are “ duds “. BD says this is not a documented issue. Happens to me all the time. Thanks
comment: Insulin is a real problem for people with #diabetes.
